API: Configuration¶

Manages environment variables, directory paths, and runtime settings.

Configuration and constants for the Parkinson Camera API.

Environment Variables:
CAMERA_MODE: Camera backend mode

  • auto: Auto-detect RealSense cameras - DEFAULT

  • mock_bag: Use .bag file playback with pyrealsense2 (for dev)

  • realsense: Live RealSense cameras (desktop/laptop)

BAG_FILE_CAM1: Path to .bag file for camera 1 (mock_bag mode) BAG_FILE_CAM2: Path to .bag file for camera 2 (mock_bag mode)

REMOTE_MODE: Set to “true” for Jetson remote deployment API_HOST: Host for API (default localhost, use 0.0.0.0 for remote)

Camera Type Priority:

  • Camera 0 (CAM1/Front) is the first detected RealSense device

  • Camera 1 (CAM2/Side) is the second detected RealSense device

Recording Behavior:

  • RealSense cameras: .bag (depth + RGB) + .mp4 (RGB preview)

  • Viewing/Tagging always uses .mp4 stream

  • Processing uses .bag (RealSense depth + RGB)

config.detect_realsense_devices(retry_count=3, retry_delay=1.0)[source]¶

Detect connected RealSense devices.

Parameters:

  • retry_count – Number of times to retry detection (for slow USB init)

  • retry_delay – Seconds to wait between retries

Returns:

[{“serial”: “…”, “name”: “…”, “usb_type”: “…”}]

Return type:

List of dicts with device info

config.get_camera_type(camera_id: int) → str[source]¶

Get the type of camera at given logical ID.

Parameters:

camera_id – Camera index (0 = Front/Sagittale, 1 = Side/Frontale)

Returns:

CAMERA_TYPE_REALSENSE or CAMERA_TYPE_BAG_FILE

Return type:

Camera type constant

config.get_detected_cameras()[source]¶

Get all detected RealSense cameras with their logical IDs.

Returns mapping of camera_id -> camera_info:

{
    0: {"type": "realsense", "serial": "...", "name": "..."},
    1: {"type": "realsense", "serial": "...", "name": "..."}
}

Camera 0 = Front/Sagittale (first detected device) Camera 1 = Side/Frontale (second detected device)

config.get_realsense_count() → int[source]¶

Get the number of detected RealSense cameras.

config.refresh_camera_detection()[source]¶

Force re-detection of cameras. Call when cameras may have changed.
